page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: In the area of our Domesday survey there are fifteen farms varying in size from twenty to four hundred acres. Many smaller farms have been absorbed into larger units in recent years. There are also numerous smallholdings of under ten acres. The main types of farming are Dairying, Beef Production, Cereal Production and the cultivation of cabbages, potatoes and broccoli. The dairy farmers have their milk production collected daily by road tanker and taken to the Unigate Creamery at St. Erth. The most popular breeds of dairy cow are the Friesians and Guernseys.
